dt: {bc}a place where persons or things are carried across a body of water (such as a river) in a boat
{bc}a franchise or right to operate a ferry service across a body of water
{bc}an organized service and route for flying airplanes especially across a sea or continent for delivery to the user

shortdef: a place where persons or things are carried across a body of water (such as a river) in a boat
a franchise or right to operate a ferry service across a body of water

dt: {bc}to carry by boat over a body of water
{bc}to convey (as by aircraft or motor vehicle) from one place to another {bc}{sx|transport||}
{bc}to fly (an airplane) from the factory or other shipping point to a designated delivery point or from one base to another

et: Middle English {it}ferien{/it}, from Old English {it}ferian{/it} to carry, convey; akin to Old English {it}faran{/it} to go {ma}{mat|fare|}{/ma}
shortdef: to carry by boat over a body of water
to convey (as by aircraft or motor vehicle) from one place to another : transport
